jobs.description:
Program to be modified:
I have an .html program I use interactively every day on the web at: 
http://www.maxton.com/temp/03172014odesk.html

It only works properly with a very limited list of cities. Essentially, one page long or less. 

I want to run more cities at one time but have run into a screen problem. The best way to see this is to run the program from the above link. The problem that needs fixing is obvious after you hit the "next" key at the bottom left side of the page. If the problem is not readily apparent then you are the wrong person for the job.

Restrictions:
I am not going to change to a different platform or non-web based software.
This .html file uses some javascript commands and html code. It is what it is.
If you need to ask me what programming language it is, please do not contact me. 

The city menu on the left side of the screen needs to work properly with the results screen. This can be accomplished if the city menu scrolls or advances independently of the results screen. It would also be nice to see some sort of counter on the next button that shows you where you are in the city menu. Or maybe the city being checked could be highlighted.

Anywhere, I've taken this program as far as I can and need help to advance it further. This will be ongoing as I see the need for modifying this program over time.
jobs.title: Web Based Search Program Modifications 03172014

jobs.description:
Are you able to design and program a pretty and functional application in JavaScript?

We require an application that will run in all browsers, and also in mobile phones. Ideally it will have a responsive design to ensure it works well on mobile phones. 

The application will identify the bulbs used in a specific car, and will display the bulbs in a visual interface. The application will then present easy-to-click links to an e-commerce site which sells the bulbs.

The application will interface with an API providing results in a JSON format, and based on the results the application will take one of several paths to display the result.

Initially, the application will request a number plate from the visitor, alternatively a list of options will be provided and the visitor must navigate drop-down menus until they select their car model.

When submitting a number plate, one of several responses will be presented:

- A unique bulb combination has been identified, and the bulbs can be displayed.
- A unique bulb combination has been identified, yet there are minor variations and the visitor must clarify what combination they have. This will be presented through drop-down choices.
- There may be two or more combinations, and the visitor must select between 2 or more car models of similar type using drop-downs.

The bulb results fall into 3 different categories: LED, halogen or xenon. The visitor should be presented with an easy way to distinguish between the different types so they can easily make their choice.

To see a similar application, visit http://www.autobulbsdirect.co.uk/citroen-xsara-picasso-mpv-2001-y

Here you can type in a UK license plate, or alternatively navigate a drop-down list of models, types and year group. When a car has been identified, a list of bulbs are available. This gives a good indication of how this will work, although our system will be slightly different.

You will need to come up with original graphics and look and feel based on our own website which is http://www.ekstralys.no/

We are currently creating an API which will present the results. When you are awarded the project we would expect you to start work immediately on the user interface and provide mockups. When approved and the API is completed you will need to start working immediately to produce the final result.

In order to be considered you must already have experience with this kind of work. Key technologies are: UI design, graphics, JavaScript, jQuery and Ajax calls.

In your bid, please provide links to JavaScript applications and to user interface designs you have made together with a realistic timescale and bid for this project. Companies with a multi-skilled team will be preferred.

Please provide a complete price, including all sensible revisions to ensure the system is fully working according to specifications and UI design.
jobs.title: Website JavaScript application with design & user interaction

jobs.description:
oDesk Professional Services is looking for an experienced Python developer. The right candidate should have solid programming experience. You will work with one of the core branches of oDesk, and building tools on top of oDesk API. 

We are looking for candidates who are willing to work full-time, if not immediately, then at least within the next few weeks. This is a long-term contract for the right candidate.

Requirements: 

+ Skills
1. Proven Python and web development experience - either in the form of top test scores or in the form of referenceable work
2. Uses JavaScript/JQuery
3. Has decent CSS design skills - i.e. can finish/polish the HTML themselves
4. Comfortable with distributed version control git/mercurial etc
5. Strong communication skills
6. Independent contractor - we are not looking to hire agency contractors at the moment. 

+ Availability
7. Available to work as soon as possible
8. Be able to allocate 30 hrs per week. The availability need could start part-time for about 2 weeks, but later on, we are hoping you can provide full-time availability.

Nice to have:
- Proven Django experience
- Proven experience developing RESTful APIs
- Have some open source contribution in Python projects
- Have community participation in Python lists/blogs etc. 

Looking forward to hearing from you!
jobs.title: Work for oDesk! Experienced Python/Django Developer

jobs.description:
We are looking for a talented and motivated developer with superior PHP/Zend framework skills to work on the oDesk Corporate site. This is an exciting opportunity to work directly on the platform you utilize as a freelancer!

This position is part of a worldwide development team, that works collaboratively in an agile environment. You will play in an important role in developing new features for our site, as well as enhancing existing code. The projects are managed by the Product Architects based in the United States, so good English skills are imperative. 

We look for individuals who are able to commit full-time (35+ hours per week). You  can work whatever schedule is best for you, we just will need you to be available a few hours in the Pacific Time Zone for meetings.  

Skills Required:
PHP, Zend Framework, Unit testing, OO design - expert level
PSQL and some Perl experience is a plus
JS/HTML5/CSS3 - strong knowledge
Good Experience in GIT
Backbone.js/Angular.js is a big plus
Sass/Compass is a big plus 
English - good


All candidates must be willing and able to conduct interviews via Skype/video/chat. This is a long term gig of 6+ months and we would want this role to be your first priority. No agencies please.
jobs.title: Work for oDesk!  PHP/Javascript Developer - Full Time Work

jobs.description:

Remote development, 2-3 months contract, 40 hours a week.

Passion for UI and able to translate user interactions to dynamic web UIs
Solid experience in creating and optimising single-page web applications using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, angular.js in particular.

TO APPLY:

jobs.description:
We have a number of affiliate links on our site that users click on to to make purchases, the money then gets kicked back to us for the purchase which we then share with the originating purchaser/user.

What we require is a cross platform plugin - if this is not possible a plugin for each - for the major browsers, primarily Windows Explorer, Google Chrome, Firefox and Safari, where a user no longer needs to make purchases via our site to get the affiliate payment share, but instead the plugin should be able to (I would imagine via database of sites that we would add) know that the user is on a certain site - for this example say the Apple site - and if a purchase is made, use 'our' affiliate link for that purchase (obviously all the user would know and opt into this service). This way, we still receive the affiliate money even if they have forgotten to shop via our site (which is a major problem) which we can then share with the user.

For information the system would need to be able to tie into our existing Drupal 7 website. However, please note we do have expert Drupal/PHP developers so might only need someone that can develop the plugin, which we can then integrate.
jobs.title: Browser Plugin for Tracking Affiliate Purchases

jobs.description:
As Front End Developer, you'll design, develop and maintain complex and highly visible web projects that address specific vertical market in the north-american industry. You'll also be responsible for proposing innovative solutions on technical issues.  This is  an ongoing project and could require some work until the end of the year.

You must: 
1. Be a PURE front-end developer, not a web integrator. 
2. Live and breathe JavaScript, AngularJs, jQuery, Bootstrap, HTML5, MongoDB
3. Be super organized, and document everything in standardized form
4. Love creating a product from the ground up.
5. Provide solutions to real-world problem with software functionalities
6. Be proud of your code 
7. Enjoy solving complex visual and algorithmic problems

We are looking for:

1. Senior/Lead Front-End Developer with 5+ years in related experience 
2. 3+ years (current) specializing in front-end JavaScript 
3. 1+ year (current) in AngularJs 
4. 1+ year (current) in MongoDB
5. 2+ years (current) in leading UI framework (Bootstrap or jQueryUI) 
6. 5 years+ (current) HTML 4/5, CSS/CSS3, LESS, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, Socket IO, Amazon AWS
7. Responsive design (media queries) 
8. Able to understand data communication with web services / SOAP / REST
9. Experience with git, and scrum development cycles

** Must use Skype AND Google Hangout **

** Excellent communication skills in english **

** Please enter your monthly rate in your bids **
